instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display on/off
threads.message:
Hi guys I have an air 2015 with a display that turns on/off all the time, or rather there is an image and then its gone after a while it flashes and comes back, and gone again. No liquid spills. Here's some info

- Replace <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> for good measure, I got 24v on LCD and backlight seems to work but no image
- I have 3.3v on LCD also when its black
- Tried with a working good dispay same issue
- replaced the LCD connector, same issue

Probably a bad data line? How to troubleshoot this?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display on/off
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display on/off
threads.message: Yeah what he said inspect the I/O board for corrosion/damage to the sleep wake sensor.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> display on/off
threads.message: Replaced the I/O Board and working fine now, thanks so much guys!
